LinkUp is a Minneapolis-based job search engine with a singular vision of delivering perfect job market information to our clients and users. We do this through proprietary and sophisticated technology that allows us to index millions of jobs directly from company websites around the world every day. We’re the global leader in delivering accurate, real-time, and predictive job market data and analytics. Every day we index millions of global job openings directly from employer websites and deliver that data to clients across industries and around the world to help them assess labor demand, understand trends, predict job growth and decline, and so much more.

We are seeking an individual who will be a key contributor to our data management team to support the ongoing growth of the company.

About The Role

You'll work as part of a fun team, using your growing skillset to help us scour the internet to build the world's best index of job opportunities and job market data.

Location

Typically, this position is located at our office in downtown Minneapolis with opportunities for remote work. Due to COVID-19, this position may start as work-from-home exclusively. We're currently discussing back-to-office plans, vaccination requirements, and et cetera with clarification to come further along in the process. As such, you'll want to make sure the following are available to you:
  • A relatively distraction-free environment to work in
  • Reliable internet connection for working and participating in video meetings
While not strictly required, we're heavily favoring candidates more local to the area. At this time, we cannot facilitate candidates who are international/require a work visa/et cetera. Equipment to work on will be provided to you. For security reasons, you will not be permitted to work from your own PC/laptop/device.

Compensation

This is a paid internship ideal for non-traditional students working on a technical degree. The pay is $20 per hour and planned to be about 20 hours per week. Since this is a part-time internship, the role does not meet the requirements to be benefits-eligible for health/dental benefits, vacation, holiday pay, or 401K plan participation.

Length of Internship

This posting is for a 5–7 month internship position.

To be successful, you'll need the following
  • Working towards a degree (or equivalent experience) in computer science or related field
  • Some experience programming in one or more modern programming languages (you'll learn PHP here if you don't already know it)
  • A baseline understanding of web technologies and protocols
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills
  • The ability to work collaboratively or independently

Someone that would be a great fit
  • Gets excited about metrics and analytics
  • Loves to write code and manipulate data
  • Sees data in everything and wants to take things apart and tinker
  • Has a natural tendency to automate and streamline things
  • Has a habit of setting measurable goals and blowing past them
  • Knows the importance of clean, consistent, documented code
  • Can read and understand code written by other people
  • Loves being a critical part of a team doing meaningful work

A Little Bit About Us

We take pride in a great company culture that is based on our core principles: work hard, have fun, think big, solve problems, and do good. To be blunt (and brag a bit), LinkUp is a great company filled with outstanding people that are incredibly talented, extremely dedicated, and really fun to work with. Along with some of our office perks such as stand-up desks, scooters, volunteer opportunities, and free snacks, we offer competitive pay, health / dental benefits, paid time off, 401k, and employee stock options.

We are seeking a motivated student who has a strong interest in the design, manufacturing, and sustaining of complex systems in the field of life science. Are you passionate about being part of a team that develops products to help make a difference in the world? Bio-Rad is looking for a Software Development intern who gets excited about product development, prototype testing and analysis, and systems integration!

Responsibilities
  • Use best software development practices to design and develop reliable and maintainable software for embedded systems used in commercial products and in-house diagnostic tools.
  • Create tools, utilities, and scripts to aid development team(s).
  • Implement embedded software solutions and algorithms to enable electromechanical system operations including graphical user interfaces, feedback control, and hardware and software interface communications.
  • Develop and execute unit, integration, and system testing, investigate and resolve issues, and perform debugging.
  • Collaborate on designs and participate in cross-functional teams to support product development and troubleshooting.


Qualifications
  • Currently enrolled as an undergraduate student pursuing a degree in Computer Science or related discipline (recent graduates will also be considered).
  • Must have a 3.0 cumulative overall GPA or better (on a 4.0 scale).
  • Strong coding skills in Python and C++.
  • Experience with real-time operating systems and an understanding of real-time issues.
  • Problem solving, organizational, and communication skills are required.
  • Able to work for a minimum of 10 consecutive weeks.
  • Strong initiative and ability to work independently and in teams.
  • Inspire collaboration, be a curious question asker, driven and self-motivated.

Bio-Rad is a global leader providing a broad array of clinical diagnostics and life science research products. With a team of more than 8,000 employees and a global network of operations serving our customers, we help people live longer, healthier lives.

Bio-Rad was founded over six decades ago and has continued to provide the healthcare industry with innovative and useful products that help life science researchers accelerate the discovery process and medical diagnostic labs obtain faster, better results.

Job Description

Company Overview:

For thirty years, SOTA Imaging has specialized in developing new and emerging technologies in the medical and dental industries. A short list of products include: dental x-ray and video imaging software, imaging devices, and optical components. Through exceptional product design, full-cycle development, and precise engineering and manufacturing, SOTA Imaging has established a reputation for creating premium products in Orange County, California. We are in need of a passionate individual to learn and grow with us as a Software Development Intern. This is a paid internship where the role of the Software Development Intern will be to undertake a problem, with the guidance of the Software Engineer, and be responsible for developing a plan to execute a solution.

The SOTA Imaging Software Development Internship will be a full-time internship with the possibility of conversion to a permanent position at the conclusion of the internship. The start of the internship will be flexible depending on the candidate’s availability.

Job Overview & Responsibilities

Interns will be provided a problem to solve. They will be responsible for preparing a proposal for how to solve the problem, and will receive guidance and support from the Software Engineer on how to improve their proposal and bring their proposed solution to completion. They will then be responsible for putting that plan into motion and will have daily feedback from the Software Engineer on their progress and the quality of their work. The end result of the internship is that they will have experienced the full development cycle of a software tool we will use internally from project conception to completion.

Intern Requirements

Requirements:
  • Experience with MySQL/Microsoft SQL Server
  • Experience with .NET, specifically C#
  • Basic understanding of OOP concepts and best practices
  • Basic understanding of standard software architecture patterns
  • Experience using Visual Studio
  • Self-starter with a history of completing personal projects
  • A recent computer science graduate (or related).
  • All applicants should send us links to personal projects on GitHub/Bitbucket and/or a personal software blog (School projects also work)
Preferred (in Addition To Requirements Above)
  • Experience with Vista DB
  • Experience with Microsoft Azure SQL
  • Experience with ASP.NET
  • Experience with Standard C++
  • Experience with JIRA/Confluence
SOTA Imaging has a 30-year history of providing leading medical and dental solutions that improve the health of society based on state of art technology. When you join SOTA Imaging, you join a team that will help you grow professionally and reward you not only financially, but also with strong incentives and a good-vibe culture. No suit and tie or corporate stuffiness. We are a goal-oriented company that likes to keep it real.

• MS/PhD in Computer Science/Engineering, or related field
  • Courses/experience in machine learning and/or data science
  • Coding experience in one or more languages – Python/C/C++/Java
  • Ability to rapidly learn by browsing large codebases
  • Familiarity with computer architecture and Linux is a plus

Overview

Appen is the world's leading innovative technology company, providing high-quality language and data services for machine learning and artificial intelligence. Appen is headquartered in Sydney, Australia, and has subsidiaries in the United States, United Kingdom, Philippines, and China. Appen has more than 20 years of experience in collecting and processing a variety of data, including data types such as speech, text, and images, etc. Appen has a pool of more than 1 million prequalified crowd resources around the world able to provide data collection and processing services in more than 180 languages. Appen’s clients include global leaders in high-tech, automotive, e-commerce, etc. and governments to help them develop and improve products and technologies based on natural language understanding and machine learning. Appen is listed on the Australian Stock Exchange with stock code: APX

About This Role

Artificial Intelligence is transforming the world in almost every industry. Everyone knows only good training data can produce the best machine learning solutions. However, creating training data with high quality in a scalable way is very challenging, and very few companies can do it. The whole AI world is starving for great training data. Appen is the market lead in training data generation field for more than 22 years and generates all kinds of training data like content relevance, image & video, text, and audio, as well as data capturing.

Appen Tech team is solving the AI data problem by combining the power of humans and technology. This world-class and exciting engineering position awaits a qualified candidate, who will join Appen’s data science team.

We are seeking a summer intern with hands-on expertise in computer vision, software development, and machine learning to build AI solutions to improve millions of annotators' efficiency at scale.  You get the opportunity to work with our global tech team from Shanghai, Silicon Valley, and Sydney. It is a leading data company with a start-up culture. And we only want people who want to make a huge impact on the AI world instead of just a job!

Responsibilities
  • Develop computer vision algorithms for automating manual annotation tasks, which include image/video/Lidar object detection, segmentation, and tracking, and many more use cases.
  • Work with the teams to build human-in-the-loop AI/ML solutions in the computer vision domain to improve annotation efficiency and quality.

Skills And Experience
  • Current Ph.D. student in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or equivalent.
  • Hands-on experience with software development, and data processing pipelines,
  • Familiar with Python, or other programming languages. Experience in PyTorch or Tensorflow.
  • Solid understanding of various deep learning and machine learning algorithms
  • Good communications skills, both verbal and written in English
  • Remote sensing experience preferred
  • Multiple object tracking experience preferred
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Please note that by applying to this role, you are agreeing to be considered for multiple positions. This is a general description of the qualifications and skills required for positions of this type of role.

Internship Project Description

Software Engineering Intern will be part of a team of talented software developers in radiotherapy treatment delivery, planning and medical imaging. RefleXion utilizes a multi-modality PET and CT system for biology-guided radiotherapy. The successful candidate will have a full stack web development experience, knowledgeable in information management, and software engineering skills.

The Software Engineer Intern will work on small product features as independent projects working closely with a Senior Software Engineer learning industry concepts. He or she will engage in development of software to support the overall product.

Intern Responsibilities And Learning Objectives
  • Intern will learn the basics of medical imaging, radiotherapy and RefleXion's technology
  • Intern will gain experience in modern web user interface design by assisting our software engineers, as well as study asynchronous client-server communication by extending the existing functionality.
  • Learn the documentation describing DICOM (Digital Imaging and Communication in Medicine) format
  • Develop new features for Treatment Planning and Treatment Delivery systems to support commercial release of Biology-guided Radiotherapy
  • Improve software infrastructure to enhance system serviceability and robustness of error reporting methods throughout the system
  • Other duties as assigned


Minimum Qualifications
  • Working towards Master's or Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field, or commensurate industry experience
  • Experience in TypeScript / JavaScript and modern ECMAScript editions
  • Experience in Angular / React or similar front end framework
  • Experience working with document driven NoSQL databases, e.g., MongoDB or CouchDB
  • Critical Thinking / Willingness to learn

The Boring Company was founded to solve the problem of soul-destroying traffic by creating an underground network of tunnels. Today, we are creating the technology to increase tunneling speed and decrease costs by a factor of 10 or more with the ultimate goal of making Hyperloop adoption viable and enabling rapid transit across densely populated regions.
As a Software Engineering Intern you will be responsible for helping build a completely new underground transportation system: the Las Vegas Loop. Every day we perform thousands of rides and collect gigabytes of data: within this role, you will primarily focus on designing and developing tools for collecting, analyzing and displaying insightful data and graphs for the Las Vegas Loop.

Responsibilities
  • Implement reliable and scalable Web services to monitor the Las Vegas Loop
  • Improve Loop operational efficiency by deploying web tools for various teams at TBC
  • Formulate statistical metrics to evaluate the Las Vegas Loop performance
  • Develop and deploy web tools to display such performance metrics
  • Clearly document and communicate design proposals
  • Support the Las Vegas Loop during hours of operations, eventually during weekends or holidays when necessary
Basic Qualifications
  • Currently pursuing a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or equivalent field
  • Prior experience in software development projects (industry or school)
  • Proficiency in 2 or more coding languages
  • Experience with Web Technologies: HTML, CSS, JS, Node.js and at least one of jQuery, React, Angular, Vue or similar
  • Understanding of how to develop Web APIs including concepts such as REST
  • Familiar with communication protocols, such as HTTP, TCP, UDP
  • Solid mathematics and statistics fundamentals
Preferred Skills And Experience
  • Ability to quickly adapt to new projects and learn new languages, technologies and concepts under tight time constraints
  • Experience with Python
  • Understanding of networking
  • Experience with Computer Science competitions such as The International Olympiad in Informatics
Additional Requirements
  • Ability to work long hours and weekends as necessary

Domeyard is seeking a Software Engineer Intern to work with us on the cutting edge of financial technologies. Our team is like a close-knit family, with an open culture like no other financial firm. You will explore the frontiers of computer science, in areas such as distributed systems, operating systems, networks, computer architecture, and data analysis. We develop and iterate quickly; you will have access to every line of code and can switch between many projects.

No financial experience is required. We hire 1-2 interns every year and genuinely nurture each individual to become an integral part of our company. In the past, we hired interns who are now full time Partners on our team. To this date, 3 Partners have made the Forbes 30 Under 30 list in Finance for their work at Domeyard. After the summer, students have the option to work part-time throughout the year until graduation.

We offer the following internship periods: Summer (full time 10 weeks), Fall (part time), Winter (part time), Winter (full time 4-5 weeks), Spring (part time).

Responsibilities:

  • Contributing to the design and implementation of the low-latency trading system
  • Working with the research team to implement data visualization tools, trading simulators, and other software solutions
  • Building real-time risk analysis and post-trade assessment tools

Qualifications:

  • Experience with C/C++ in a UNIX environment
  • Python, Bash, and shell scripting skills
  • University level coursework in computer science (e.g. operating systems, computer architecture, and algorithms)
  • Knowledge of software design patterns and best practices
  • Strong written and verbal communications skills
  • Excellent problem-solving abilities

  • About The Team ---

    Domeyard LP is a hedge fund based in Boston. As one of the fastest market participants in the world, Domeyard leverages advances in high-performance computing and data analysis to implement trading algorithms across a diverse range of assets, including equities, futures, fixed income, energies and commodities. Domeyard has received multiple accolades within the hedge fund industry and is the protagonist of Harvard Business School's first case study about high frequency trading.

    Domeyard is a flat organization. There are no walls between teams, and ideas are exchanged freely throughout the company. You will get to know everyone in the company, including across teams. Our flexible work hours, casual dress code, generous employee benefits, and startup environment (gaming room, team events and of course, free food) ensure that you can commit fully to your intellectual interests. The diversity within our team reflects Domeyard's core values, and we do sponsor H-1B visas.

Overview

Paid internship position at the United States Coast Guard Operations Systems Center located in Kearneysville, WV.

position: Research Intern - Image and Video Algorithms
description:
Company: Kuaishou TechnologyC

Position: Research Intern - Image and Video Algorithms  

Location: Palo Alto, CA

 

About the company:

Kuaishou is a short video social platform for all users to record and share their lives, with the core mission to "Capture the World, Share Your Story" to increase every individual's happiness through Big Data and AI technology.

 

Kuaishou is one of the world's leading life-sharing community with more than 300 million daily active users and more than 20 billion short videos at the end of January 2020.

 

Kuaishou enables users to record their daily lives in short videos and share memorable moments as well as interact with followers in real-time through live streaming. For the first time in history, users from all over the world are connected and their stories shared in the form of video at Kuaishou.

 

You may visit https://usrdc.kuaishou.com/ to learn more about us.

Contact us: career-us@kuaishou.com 

 

About the position:

Image and video live everywhere in our life, image and video related algorithms play crucial roles from content creating to consuming in Kuaishou’s ecosystem. The Lab of Advanced Image and Video Algorithms is responsible for researching and developing innovative and optimized solutions to ensure the best user experiences, inspire the creation of more contents, and maintain the highest efficiency on different platforms, including mobile devices and CPU/GPU servers. We are looking for research interns who are excited in developing cutting-edge algorithms and solutions for image/video applications with skills in image/video processing, computational photography, computer vision, and algorithm optimization for both mobile devices and servers.

 

Job Responsibilities:

•        Explore and develop innovative algorithms in the areas of image and video processing, computational photography, computer vision, and deep learning

•        Collaborate with other researchers and engineers on algorithm optimization and product integration

 

Qualifications:

•        Graduate student actively pursuing MSc or PhD degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related majors

•        Familiar with image and video processing, deep learning, computer vision, and/or computational photography

•        Good communication skills and teamwork

As the health and safety of our candidates and our employees come first, we're excited to provide virtual experiences for interviews and new hire on-boarding.

Who We Are

Dataminr puts real-time AI and public data to work for our clients, generating relevant and actionable alerts for global corporations, public sector agencies, newsrooms, and NGOs. Our leading AI platform detects the earliest signals of high-impact events and emerging risks from vast amounts of publicly available information. Our real-time alerts enable tens of thousands of users at hundreds of public and private sector organizations to learn first of breaking events around the world, develop effective risk mitigation strategies, and respond with confidence as crises unfold.

Dataminr is making its mark for growth and innovation, recently earning recognition on the Deloitte Technology Fast 500, Forbes AI 50 and Forbes Cloud 100 lists. We also earned accolades for ‘Most Innovative Use of AI’ from the 2020 AI & Machine Learning Awards.

Join our team and help the world manage risk in real time. You’ll work with 600+ talented people across seven offices, united by our passion to collaborate, make a difference, and have fun while doing it!

Type: Internship

Experience: PhD/Graduate Students

Who You Are

You’re a Ph.D. candidate who has published in top tier conferences and are passionate about having a positive impact on the world. You are enthusiastic about working on some of the most challenging problems in AI, working in a highly collaborative environment and directly contributing to products while advancing the state of the art. You are very creative, can work independently, and are an excellent collaborator and communicator.

Responsibilities

  • Perform research to advance the state of the art and solve specific problems at scale in Complex Networks
  • Work closely with a diverse, interdisciplinary team on a specific project to be completed during the internship.
  • Excel in placing a human-centered focus on the work (context, end-user impact, etc), finding solutions that work in practice and have significant impact.

Minimum Qualifications

  • Must be enrolled in a Ph.D. program in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or a related field.
  • Ideal candidates will have had prior internship experience.
  • Outstanding publication record in the candidate’s field of study (ACL, CVPR, CHI, WWW, RecSys, ICCV, NIPS, ICML, etc.).
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently, set up experiments and demonstrate progress through principled used of metrics.

Individuals seeking employment at Dataminr are considered without regards to race, sex, color, creed, religion, national origin, age, disability, genetics, marital status, pregnancy, unemployment status, sexual orientation, citizenship status or veteran status.

Description

Los Angeles based Internet Brands is looking for a Quality Assurance Intern to be part of the QA team. This position has great potential for learning and advancement.

Quality Assurance Interns will be responsible for executing black box testing on a number of web-based projects under the guidance of senior QA team members. They will be trained in the company’s Quality Assurance process and be given opportunities to contribute to the creation of test cases and scripts.

The ideal candidate will have a background in computer science, meticulous attention to detail, strong analytical skills, and strong written and verbal communication skills. A degree in Computer Science or web development experience is strongly encouraged, but is not required. Prior quality assurance experience or software development experience is a plus.

This is a part-time, paid position at $20/hr.

Responsibilities
  • Executing black box tests on all web-based and desktop application-based products.
  • Executing and help develop automated test cases.
  • Identifying issues and generating issue reports.
  • Reproducing customer-reported issues.
  • Assisting developers with issue analysis.
  • Developing automated test scripts.
  • Actively participating in test case design and script maintenance.
  • Verification of patches and bug fixes.
  • Interfacing closely with programmers and other QA engineers.
Qualifications
  • An understanding of web-delivered applications.
  • Familiarity with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, or other web development languages.
  • Familiarity with multiple web browsers (Internet Explorer, Firefox, Safari, Chrome, etc.)
  • Experience with Microsoft Office (Word & Excel).
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills within a team environment.
  • A Bachelors of Science degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering, or enrollment in one of these majors, is a plus but not required.
  • Experience working in a web development company is a plus.
  • Software development experience is a plus.
  • Software quality assurance experience is a plus.
About Internet Brands

Headquartered in El Segundo, Calif., Internet Brands® is a fully integrated online media and software services organization focused on four high-value vertical categories: Health, Automotive, Legal, and Home/Travel. The company's award-winning consumer websites lead their categories and serve more than 250 million monthly visitors, while a full range of web presence offerings has established deep, long-term relationships with SMB and enterprise clients. Internet Brands' powerful, proprietary operating platform provides the flexibility and scalability to fuel the company's continued growth. Internet Brands is a portfolio company of KKR and Temasek. For more information, please visit www.internetbrands.com.

Internet Brands and its wholly-owned affiliates are an equal opportunity employer.

About Internet Brands

Headquartered in El Segundo, Calif., Internet Brands® is a fully integrated online media and software services organization focused on four high-value vertical categories: Health, Automotive, Legal, and Home/Travel. The company's award-winning consumer websites lead their categories and serve more than 250 million monthly visitors, while a full range of web presence offerings has established deep, long-term relationships with SMB and enterprise clients. Internet Brands' powerful, proprietary operating platform provides the flexibility and scalability to fuel the company's continued growth. Internet Brands is a portfolio company of KKR and Temasek. For more information, please visit www.internetbrands.com.

Internet Brands and its wholly-owned affiliates are an equal opportunity employer.

International Students: If your work authorization is through CPT, please consult your school before applying. You must be able to work 40 hours per week. Many students will be limited to part-time depending on their academic standing.

Internship Program at Tesla

The Internship Recruiting Team is driven by the passion to recognize emerging talent. Our year around program places the best students in positions that they will grow both technically and personally through their experience working closely with their Manager, Mentor, and team. We are dedicated to providing an experience that allows for the intern to experience life at Tesla by given them projects that are critical to their team’s success.

Instead of going on coffee runs and making copies, you’ll be seated at the table making critical decisions that will influence not only your team, but the overall achievement of Tesla’s mission.

Locations
  • Palo Alto, CA
  • Fremont, CA
  • Sparks, NV
  • Buffalo, NY

About The Team

Tesla is seeking highly-motivated post-secondary interns to contribute to the design and development of new automation equipment and assembly lines for our advanced production facilities. This is an exciting opportunity to be a part of the team “building the machine that makes the machine”. Tesla is a demanding and fast-paced environment where you will work on a critical subsystem of incredibly exciting products.

Departments
  • Automation Development
  • Vehicle Manufacturing
  • Paint Manufacturing

What To Expect

The Automation Controls Engineering Intern will work under the guidance of Controls Engineers to develop, design, and program control systems for new equipment being deployed to the production floor. description:

As a Robotics Intern at PickNik Robotics you'll be helping develop software applications and integrating solutions for our clients, internal products, and flagship open source projects. Your duties will include contributing to open source robotics software that will be used on robots around the world (and in outer space!). You will use C++ and Python for coding, provide documentation and tutorials, and create a blog post to highlight your accomplishments. At the end of your internship you will have made a substantial contribution to one of the open source packages that PickNik relies on such as MoveIt!

Am I a good fit?
  • You love robotics and have a passion for creating the next generation of robot software.
  • You are excited to be part of a small team of experts with a steady flow of client projects.
  • You should work efficiently, be ready to learn, and have great attention to detail.
  • You have desire to contribute to open source projects solving big problems.
  • You have the ability to collaborate with teams around the world.
  • You need to be in the Greater Denver area (or spend significant time there) to foster a great team learning environment.


Requirements
  • Completed or working on a 2nd year Masters or PhD degree(s) in Computer Science, Mechanical/Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
  • Knowledge of C++.
  • Familiarity with at least one scripting language such as Python or Matlab.
  • Comfortable with Linux.


Preferred Skills/Experience
  • Experience with ROS, MoveIt!, and Gazebo are advantageous
  • General experience with motion planning, inverse kinematics, control systems, graph theory, and/or simulation
  • Experience with common open source libraries and tools such as Eigen, OGRE, Qt, CMake, Bazel, and Protobufs
  • Experience with Git version control, software testing, and continuous integration
  • Demonstrated ability, either through previous projects, advanced education/research, and/or knowledge of the robotics field

About Cubist

Cubist Systematic Strategies is one of the world’s premier investment firms. The firm deploys systematic, computer-driven trading strategies across multiple liquid asset classes, including equities, futures and foreign exchange. The core of our effort is rigorous research into a wide range of market anomalies, fueled by our unparalleled access to a wide range of publicly available data sources.

Job Description

This is an opportunity for students and researchers of advanced data modeling and statistical learning methods to apply these techniques to market prediction and systematic trading.

Job Responsibilities
  • Reseach interesting trading ideas from academic papers, blogs, and other sources
  • Pre-process (validate, clean, normalize, reduce dimension) very large data sets for model estimation and event studies
  • Identify features and relationships useful for the predictive modeling of market dynamics
  • Design and implement systematic strategies that can exploit market abnormalities
Desirable Candidates
  • Undergraduate, MS, or PhD candidates in finance, computer science, mathematics, physics, or other quantitative discipline
  • Programming in any of the following: C++, Java, C#, MATLAB, R, Python, or Perl
  • Strong analytical and quantitative skills
  • Demonstrated interest in financial markets and systematic trading
  • Clear, concise, and proactive communicator
  • Detail-oriented
  • Willing to take ownership of his/her work, working both independently and within a small team
We’re looking for exceptional colleagues with unparalleled passion. If you’d like your resume to stand out, tell us about your exceptional personal achievements, even if they have nothing to do with finance. Of course we love to hear more about specific engineering or data projects that you’ve worked outside of school, or as part of your curriculum. If you’re proud of the work you did we want to hear about it. In addition to exceptional statisticians and engineers, we work with talented musicians, writers, mathematicians, and founders of non-profits; we’d love to learn more about what excites you.

position: Quality Engineer - Entry Level Intern for PivotAi
description:
At PivotAi, we are constantly developing new automation products by combining robotic process automation (RPA) with cognitive Al technologies like computer vision and natural language processing. We create both consumer and enterprise solutions that automate manual data entry, generate key insights from documents, and process applications and claims. Creating test plans and performing QA on our products is essential due our agile, rapid development process. This is a paid Internship working in our offices located at 38 Austin Street, Worcester, MA.

In This Role You Will Be Expected To
  • Collaborate with Product Leads and Software Engineers to define, implement, and document PivotAi's test strategy and best practices
  • Prioritize issues in the backlog based on market and user feedback
  • Compare code-generated outputs to human-generated outputs in order to analyze any discrepancies, and push fixes to our engineering team
  • Document user stories and defects and assign them to the engineering team via Asana
Responsibilities
  • Need to comprehensively understand the workflow and processes involved for our products
  • Must maintain a "user focused" mentality when assessing front end interfaces, and output elements of any project
  • Recommend thoughtful UI/UX improvements for PivotAi's products
  • Organize current issues in a way that is easy for the Project/Product Manager to understand so the fixes can be completed by our engineering team in a timely manner Help our team find and test new software technologies to be implemented in any current/future projects
  • Opportunities to develop small code modules that fit into our full-scale apps
Desired Skills
  • Strong attention to detail for assessing large data sets and computer outputs
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Any prior knowledge or education in Computer Science and/or UI/UX
  • Experience with Python or any other object-oriented programming languages
  • Past experience with GitHub and project management skills
PM17

Overview

 Overview

Appen is the world's leading innovative technology company, providing high-quality language and data services for machine learning and artificial intelligence. Appen is headquartered in Sydney, Australia and has subsidiaries in United States, United Kingdom, Philippines, and China. Appen has more than 20 years of experience in collecting and processing a variety of data, including data types such as speech, text, and images, etc. Appen has a pool of more than 1 million prequalified crowd resources around the world able to provide data collection and processing services in more than 180 languages. Appen’s client include global leaders in high-tech, automotive, e-commerce, etc. and governments to help them develop and improve products and technologies based on natural language understanding and machine learning. Appen is listed on the Australian Stock Exchange with stock code: APX

Speech Engineer Summer Intern Job Description

Artificial Intelligence is transforming the world in almost every industry. Everyone knows only good training data can produce the best machine learning solutions. However, creating training data with high quality in a scalable way is very challenging, and very few companies can do it. The whole AI world is starving for great training data. Appen is the market lead in training data generation field for more than 22 years. It generates all kinds of training data like content relevance, image & video, text & audio, as well as data capturing.

Appen Tech team is solving the AI data problem by combining the power of humans and technology. This world-class and exciting engineering position awaits a qualified candidate who will join Appen’s data science team.

We are seeking a summer intern of speech engineer with hands-on expertise in speech processing, speech recognition, software development, and machine learning to build AI solutions to improve millions of annotators' efficiency at scale. You get the opportunity to work with our global tech team from Shanghai, Silicon Valley, and Sydney. It is a leading data company with a start-up culture. And we only want people who want to make a huge impact on the AI world instead of just a job!

Key Responsibilities
  • Develop speech processing algorithms for automating manual annotation tasks, which includes speech separation, speech detection, speech segmentation, speech recognition, speaker diarization and speaker recognition, etc.
  • Work with the teams to build human-in-the-loop AI/ML solutions in speech processing and speech recognition domain to improve annotation efficiency and quality.
Skills and Requirements
  • Current Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or related areas is required for this position.
  • Hands-on experience in speech related AI/ML fields.
  • Familiar with mainstream speech recognition toolsets, like Kaldi, Tensorflow, Pytorch etc.
  • Solid understanding of ASR theories and algorithms, from traditional methods to modern deep learning-based techs.
  • Solid knowledge of machine learning and deep learning algorithms.
  • Familiar with C/C++, Python, or other programming languages.
  • Excellent communications skills, both verbal and written in English

Please note that by applying to this role, you are agreeing to be considered for multiple positions. This is a general description of the qualifications and skills required for positions of this type of role.

Job Description

The perception team develops cutting edge technologies to help our truck perceive the world. You will play an important role in creating novel algorithms for advanced perception and applying your algorithm on terabytes of data. You will also work closely with other talents in this field in building the next-generation of autonomous sensing algorithms.

Example projects that we are working on:
  • Temporal association of data from multiple sensors, including camera, LiDAR, RADAR and more
  • Object tracking and state estimation in challenging real world scenarios
  • Encoding perception uncertainty and collaborate with prediction team to make the system safe and robust


Responsibilities
  • Formulate, prototype and deploy robust and reliable solutions to cutting-edge perception problems, including sensor fusion, tracking, and state estimation.
  • Investigate and develop computer vision algorithms and machine learning models for the perception system.
  • Build benchmark with proper methodology and analyze large-scale data to characterize algorithms performance.
  • Closely collaborate with other teams to conduct system design, integration and tests.


Qualifications
  • M.S. in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Robotics or other related fields.
  • Hands-on experience in computer vision, machine learning for perception, robotics, autonomous system, object tracking, sensor fusion, localization and mapping etc.
  • Strong coding skills in C/C++ and Python


Preferred
  • Ph.D. in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Robotics or other related fields.
  • Extensive experience in computer vision, machine learning for perception, robotics, autonomous system, object tracking, sensor fusion, localization and mapping etc.
  • Publications in top-tier computer vision/machine learning conferences and/or journals.
  • Knowledge and experience of GPU computation or CUDA acceleration.

Perks
  • Work with world class AI Engineers.
  • Shape the landscape of autonomous driving.
  • Daily breakfast, lunch, and dinner.
  • Full Kitchen with unlimited snacks and fruits.

Speech Engineer Summer Intern Job Description

Artificial Intelligence is transforming the world in almost every industry. Everyone knows only good training data can produce the best machine learning solutions. However, creating training data with high quality in a scalable way is very challenging, and very few companies can do it. The whole AI world is starving for great training data. Appen is the market lead in training data generation field for more than 22 years. It generates all kinds of training data like content relevance, image & video, text & audio, as well as data capturing.

Appen Tech team is solving the AI data problem by combining the power of humans and technology. This world-class and exciting engineering position awaits a qualified candidate who will join Appen’s data science team.

We are seeking a summer intern of speech engineer with hands-on expertise in speech processing, speech recognition, software development, and machine learning to build AI solutions to improve millions of annotators' efficiency at scale. You get the opportunity to work with our global tech team from Shanghai, Silicon Valley, and Sydney. It is a leading data company with a start-up culture. And we only want people who want to make a huge impact on the AI world instead of just a job!

Key Responsibilities
  • Develop speech processing algorithms for automating manual annotation tasks, which includes speech separation, speech detection, speech segmentation, speech recognition, speaker diarization and speaker recognition, etc.
  • Work with the teams to build human-in-the-loop AI/ML solutions in speech processing and speech recognition domain to improve annotation efficiency and quality.
Skills and Requirements
  • Current Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or related areas is required for this position.
  • Hands-on experience in speech related AI/ML fields.
  • Familiar with mainstream speech recognition toolsets, like Kaldi, Tensorflow, Pytorch etc.
  • Solid understanding of ASR theories and algorithms, from traditional methods to modern deep learning-based techs.
  • Solid knowledge of machine learning and deep learning algorithms.
  • Familiar with C/C++, Python, or other programming languages.
  • Excellent communications skills, both verbal and written in English

PARC, a Xerox company, is in the Business of Breakthroughs®. Practicing open innovation, we provide custom R&D services, technology, expertise, best practices, and intellectual property to Fortune 500 and Global 1000 companies, startups, and government agencies and partners.   • Familiarity with Message Brokers (e.g., ActiveMQ, RabbitMQ, Kafka) and their use in distributed systems
  • Platforms: MacOS, Ubuntu
  • Scripting: zsh, bash

Daiichi Sankyo Group is dedicated to the creation and supply of innovative pharmaceutical therapies to improve standards of care and address diversified, unmet medical needs of people globally by leveraging our world-class science and technology. With more than 100 years of scientific expertise and a presence in more than 20 countries, Daiichi Sankyo and its 15,000 employees around the world draw upon a rich legacy of innovation and a robust pipeline of promising new medicines to help people. Job Summary

Daiichi Sankyo is seeking a year round IT Intern to work for approximately 20 hours per week. The ideal candidate will be able to plan, organize and communicate well and have the ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects. Ability to work independently is necessary for success, along with working collaboratively with all levels of the IT team.

Responsibilities

This internship will support multiple projects to assist the IT Business Intelligence and Data Management team by:
  • Capturing stakeholder requirements to facilitate the agile project management lifecycle
  • Developing and deploying testing methods to validate data quality and project deliverables
  • Designing data visualizations for dashboards and reporting
  • Exploring emerging technologies to enhance and automate day-to-day processes
  • Utilizing data science tools and techniques to uncover business insights
In this role you will be preparing routine and ad hoc data extractions from the data warehouse, providing scheduled and ad hoc reports, dashboards and analysis summaries. There will also be opportunities to present routine information/data to internal and external clients. You will be working with PowerBI, Informatica Intelligent Cloud Services (IICS) and Microsoft Azure SQL database, prior experience in these applications is preferred.

Education/Experience

Prior experience in a corporate business environment is a plus. Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Power Point) is required. Excellent written and verbal communication skills and time management skills are essential. Key skills required for the assignment are the ability to generate ideas, analyze an issue, problem-solve and demonstrate learning agility.

About

Founded in 1955, American River College (ARC) is one of the largest institutions of higher education in the Sacramento region, serving about 30,000 diverse students each fall and spring at its main campus and centers.
Our Strengths
The College has an outstanding record for academic quality and is among the top community colleges in the state for transferring students to the University of California and California State University systems. The College offers education and support for students to strengthen basic skills, earn associate degrees and certificates, transfer to other colleges and universities, and achieve a career as well as other academic and personal goals. ARC also has a strong reputation for its wide array of career programs in areas such as Healthcare, Hospitality, Human Services, Business and Computer Science, Public Safety, Applied Arts, Advanced Transportation and Manufacturing and Apprenticeship.
Our Vision
Our vision is to transform the future of all students and our community through inclusive, equitable education. The College seeks individuals who share our mission of placing students first by providing an academically rich, inclusive environment that inspires critical thinking, learning and achievement, and responsible participation in the community.
Our Commitment to Social Justice and Equity
American River College strives to uphold the dignity and humanity of every student and employee. We are committed to equity and social justice through equity-minded education, transformative leadership, and community engagement. We believe this commitment is essential to achieving our mission and enhancing our community. The College seeks candidates who are committed to culturally inclusive practices and serving the ARC's student population. Faculty and staff are encouraged to engage in the ongoing development of their professional skills. The College thus supports employee engagement in a broad range of trainings, workshops, and activities such as the Equity Action Institute, the New Faculty Academy, and the Classified Leadership Academy. Also, faculty and staff regularly participate in trainings offered through the College's Center for Teaching and Learning and its Instructional Technology Center.

position: Assessor Clerk Recorder - Professional Student Intern (Paid)
description:
About The Position

The Riverside County Assessor Clerk Recorder (ACR) has an internship opportunity that will provide support to the Mapping Division by performing a wide variety of GIS tasks as well as routine clerical tasks. The selected intern will gain hands-on GIS work experience and an understanding of the role of the County Assessor Clerk Recorder as it relates to the transfer of ownership, assessment processes, reading and interpreting recorded maps and legal descriptions.

In addition to meeting all minimum qualifications listed below, the most qualified candidates will have a Cadastral and GIS background.

The Riverside County Assessor Clerk Recorder Internship is based out of Riverside and will have a flexible work week consisting of approximately 20 hours per week.

Examples Of Essential Duties

Assist with updating GIS data layers and assessor maps.

Assist with researching and compiling data from record maps and deeds.

Perform routine clerical tasks including, but not limited to, scanning, organizing, filing, typing, reviewing documents for accuracy, sorting, and logging.

Minimum Qualifications

Cumulative Grade Point Average : Minimum 2.5 GPA required. Proof of most current unofficial/official transcript with cumulative GPA must be provided at time of application .

Education: Applicants must be currently enrolled/attending school at an accredited college or university, in a Bachelor's program during the entire duration of the internship. All recent college graduates are eligible to intern for up to one year (twelve months) from their graduation date. Graduation date is not to exceed twelve month maximum during the entire duration of the internship.

Areas of Study : Accounting, Finance, Public or Business Administration, Human Resources, Organizational Studies, Information Technology, Computer Science, or similar.

Experience, Knowledge, Abilities : Modern office practices and procedures and operating standard office equipment (computers, scanners, telephones, etc.); Common basic arithmetic; Proper customer service technique; Knowledge of common software such as MS Outlook, Word, Excel.

**All applicants, including alumni, are required to include a current resume and most recent unofficial/official transcript. Document(s) must be uploaded as attachments at time of application to be considered.**

Upload a copy of your (or your spouse's) Member-4 Form DD-214 or NGB-22 indicating dates of service, and a copy of your spouse's letter of disability (if applicable) with your application. For privacy reasons, it is recommended that you remove your social security information from the document(s). A Human Resources Representative will review the materials and determine if you qualify for Veteran's Preference. Policy is available here: https://www.rivcocob.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/07/C-3-Veterans-Preference-Program.pdf

What's Next?

This recruitment is open to all applicants currently enrolled/attending school at an accredited college or universityor have recently graduated within the past twelve months.

No late applications will be permitted and changes or alterations cannot be accepted. Resumes that include job descriptions and duties copied from the job classification will not be considered.

Applications received prior to the closing date will be considered based on the information submitted. Include relevant work experience details on resume and/or application. Applicants who fail to provide information demonstrating they possess the position requirements may not be considered further in the application process.

General Information

For more information, please contact lsilva@rivco.org.

Temporary employees participate in the 401(a) Temporary and Part-Time Employees' Retirement Plan and are required to contribute 3.75% of salary to the pension plan.
